p: Dengue virus (DENV) is a global public health threat with epidemics mostly reported in urban and semi-urban areas [ 1, 2]. Dengue virus consists of four related serotypes (DENV-1-4), belonging to the genus Flavivirus (Family: Flaviviridae) [ 3]. The most recent epidemics in Africa have predominantly been reported in East African countries, with DENV-2 responsible for the highest number of epidemics [ 4, 5]. Dengue epidemics have been linked to urbanization, globalization, climate change, and the broad distributional range of the primary vector, Aedes aegypti [ 6â€“ 9].
